t: AWS service endpoints - AWS General Reference
s: But you can specify an alternate endpoint for your API requests. If a service supports Regions, the resources in each Region are independent of similar resources in other Regions. For example, you can create an Amazon EC2 instance or an Amazon SQS queue in one Region.

t: Amazon.com: Endpoint
Amazon EC2 service endpoints - Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud
s: When you make a request, you can specify the endpoint to use. If you do not specify an endpoint, the IPv4 endpoint is used by default. To use a different endpoint type, you must specify it in your request. For examples of how to do this, see Specifying endpoints.

t: Access an AWS service using an interface VPC endpoint - Amazon Virtual Private Cloud
s: An endpoint network interface is a requester-managed network interface; you can view it in your AWS account, but you can't manage it yourself.

t: Amazon EC2 endpoints and quotas - AWS General Reference
s: To connect programmatically to an AWS service, you use an endpoint. AWS services offer the following endpoint types in some or all of the AWS Regions that the service supports: IPv4 endpoints, dual-stack endpoints, and FIPS endpoints. Some services provide global endpoints.

t: Endpoints - Amazon Pinpoint
s: Note: Quotas apply to the number of custom attributes that you can define for endpoints. If you send a PUT request that defines additional custom attributes for a batch of endpoints and the addition of these attributes exceeds these quotas, Amazon Pinpoint returns an HTTP 400 response.

t: What is the com.amazonaws.vpce Endpoint service? | AWS re:Post
Endpoint - Amazon Pinpoint
s: Note: Quotas apply to the number of custom attributes that you can define for endpoints. If you send a PUT request that defines additional custom attributes for an endpoint and the addition of these attributes exceeds these quotas, Amazon Pinpoint returns an HTTP 400 response.

t: Configure an endpoint service - Amazon Virtual Private Cloud
s: By default, your endpoint service is not available to service consumers. You must add permissions that allow specific AWS principals to create an interface VPC endpoint to connect to your endpoint service. To add permissions for an AWS principal, you need its Amazon Resource Name (ARN).
